title: Ternary Operator
description: The ternary operator provides a concise conditional expression: condition ? valueIfTrue : valueIfFalse. It evaluates the condition and returns one of two values based on the result. Only the selected branch is evaluated (short-circuit). Ternary operators can be nested but become hard to read - use if/else for complex conditions. The types of both branches must be compatible. Common uses include: conditional assignment, inline min/max, default values. This example demonstrates basic ternary usage, nested ternaries, and practical applications like value clamping and conditionally selecting expressions.
